feed.title: Korthauer Lab
feed.subtitle: We work on advancing statistical methodology and computational tools for the analysis of high-dimensional genomics data. With these tools, we aim to uncover new molecular signals in cancer, child health, and development.

entry.title: Keegan awarded Michael Smith Health Research BC Scholar Award

link.title: Keegan awarded Michael Smith Health Research BC Scholar Award

entry.content: Keegan has been recognized by Michael Smith Health Research BC with a Scholar Award (2025-2030). This award will support our team’s efforts in building scalable computational tools to decode molecular processes in cancer, child health, and development.
entry.summary: Keegan has been recognized by Michael Smith Health Research BC with a Scholar Award (2025-2030). This award will support our team’s efforts in building scalable computational tools to decode molecular processes in cancer, child health, and development.

entry.title: Ning presenting at European Bioconductor Conference (EuroBioC2025)

link.title: Ning presenting at European Bioconductor Conference (EuroBioC2025)

entry.content: Ning is presenting her work on “decemedip: hierarchical Bayesian modeling for cell type deconvolution of immunoprecipitation-based DNA methylomes” at European Bioconductor Conference (EuroBioC2025) at the Barcelona Biomedical Research Park, in Barcelona, Spain!
entry.summary: Ning is presenting her work on “decemedip: hierarchical Bayesian modeling for cell type deconvolution of immunoprecipitation-based DNA methylomes” at European Bioconductor Conference (EuroBioC2025) at the Barcelona Biomedical Research Park, in Barcelona, Spain!

entry.title: Congratulations to Ning on her successful PhD defence!

link.title: Congratulations to Ning on her successful PhD defence!

entry.content: Congratulations to Ning Shen on successfully defending her PhD thesis, titled “Probabilistic modeling of high-throughput sequencing data for enhanced understanding of DNA methylation heterogeneity”!
entry.summary: Congratulations to Ning Shen on successfully defending her PhD thesis, titled “Probabilistic modeling of high-throughput sequencing data for enhanced understanding of DNA methylation heterogeneity”!

entry.title: Two new preprints!
entry.content:
We are excited to share the latest research led by Korthauer lab members!

  • Erick’s preprint exploring how much genetics and the environment contribute to shaping the early life DNA methylome: “RAMEN: Dissecting individual, additive and interactive gene-environment contributions to DNA methylome variability in cord blood” - in collaboration with the Kobor lab.

  • Ning’s preprint introducing a tool for cell type deconvolution of methylated sequencing reads: “decemedip: hierarchical Bayesian modeling for cell type deconvolution of immunoprecipitation-based DNA methylomes” - in collaboration with the Baca lab.
entry.summary: We are excited to share the latest research led by Korthauer lab members!

entry.title: Korthauer lab highlights at BIG25
entry.content: Several lab members participated in the 2025 BIG Research day with this years’ theme being the “Intelligent Genome.” Keegan was one of two speakers in the invited session on “Novel Techniques”. Erick’s abstract was one of 10 selected for an oral presentation in the Student Mini Symposium, and was awarded 2nd place! Irvin presented his research with a poster, alongside close to 200 other trainees!
entry.summary: Several lab members participated in the 2025 BIG Research day with this years’ theme being the “Intelligent Genome.” Keegan was one of two speakers in the invited session on “Novel Techniques”. Erick’s abstract was one of 10 selected for an oral presentation in the Student Mini Symposium, and was awarded 2nd place! Irvin presented his research with a poster, alongside close to 200 other trainees!

entry.title: Ning presented at BioC 2024
entry.content: Ning presented her work on “vmrseq: Probabilistic Modeling of Single-cell Methylation Heterogeneity” at the 2024 Bioconductor Conference at the Van Andel Institute in Grand Rapids, Michigan, USA.
entry.summary: Ning presented her work on “vmrseq: Probabilistic Modeling of Single-cell Methylation Heterogeneity” at the 2024 Bioconductor Conference at the Van Andel Institute in Grand Rapids, Michigan, USA.

entry.title: Interview with Dr. Korthauer featured in March 2024 CMMT Newsletter

link.title: Interview with Dr. Korthauer featured in March 2024 CMMT Newsletter

entry.content: The March 2024 Newsletter from the Centre for Molecular Medicine and Therapeutics featured an interview with Dr. Korthauer, highlighting her academic journey and some current projects in the lab.
entry.summary: The March 2024 Newsletter from the Centre for Molecular Medicine and Therapeutics featured an interview with Dr. Korthauer, highlighting her academic journey and some current projects in the lab.

entry.title: Erick wins poster award at UBC Life Sciences Symposium!

link.title: Erick wins poster award at UBC Life Sciences Symposium!

entry.content: Erick’s poster presentation “Modeling the genome and exposome contribution to newborn methylome variability with the RAMEN package” won an award (with cash prize) at the 2024 UBC Life Sciences Symposium! Congratulations, Erick!
entry.summary: Erick’s poster presentation “Modeling the genome and exposome contribution to newborn methylome variability with the RAMEN package” won an award (with cash prize) at the 2024 UBC Life Sciences Symposium! Congratulations, Erick!

entry.title: Congratulations to our two Fall 2023 MS graduates!

link.title: Congratulations to our two Fall 2023 MS graduates!

entry.content: Congratulations to Korthauer lab members Giuliano Netto Flores Cruz (MS Bioinformatics, pictured below) and Giuesppe Tinti Tomio (MS Statistics)!!
entry.summary: Congratulations to Korthauer lab members Giuliano Netto Flores Cruz (MS Bioinformatics, pictured below) and Giuesppe Tinti Tomio (MS Statistics)!!

entry.title: New preprint
entry.content: Our new preprint, “vmrseq: Probabilistic Modeling of Single-cell Methylation Heterogeneity” is posted!
entry.summary: Our new preprint, “vmrseq: Probabilistic Modeling of Single-cell Methylation Heterogeneity” is posted!
